abstract.para: This document is a reference for the MapServer version 3.5 HTML template.
It is based on the previous versions written by Steve Lime steve.lime@dnr.state.mn.us

sect1.title: MapServer - Documentation: Template File Reference
sect1.para: Templates are used to define the look of an interface and to guide the presentation of results, either a query or a map, to the user. A template can be either a URL (eg. http://www.somewhere.com/[ATTRIBUTE]/info.html) or HTML file(s). Simple pan/zoom interfaces use a single template file while compilicated queries often require many templates. URL templates can only be used with simple QUERY or ITEMQUERY results so many substitutions defined below are not available.

listitem.para: Template substitution strings are case sensitive.
Attribute item substitutions must be the same case as the item names in the dbase file.
ArcView and ArcInfo generally produce dbase files with item names that are all uppercase. Appropriate URL encoding (i.e. ' ' to '+') is applied when templates are URLs.
Some substitutions are also available in escaped form (i.e. url encoded).

sect1.title: Format
sect1.para: Templates are simply HTML files or URL strings that contains special characters that are replaced by mapserv each time the template is processed. The simple substitution allows information such as active layers or the spatial extent to be passed from the user to mapserv and back again. Most often the new values are dumped into form variables that will be passed on again. The list of special characters and form variables is given below. HTML templates can include just about anything including javascript and java calls.

listitem.para: The MapServer version number.

Unique session id. The id can be passed in via a form but is more commonly generated by the software. In that case the id is a concatenation of UNIX time (or NT equivalent) and the process id. Unless your getting more requests in a second than allowable process ids the id can be considered unique. ;->
Hostname of the web server.
Port the web server is listening to.

varlistentry.term: [post or get variable name], [post or get variable name_esc]

listitem.para: The contents of any variables passed to the MapServer, whether they were used or not, can be echoed this way. One use might be to have the user set a map title or north arrow style in an interactive map composer. The system doesn't care about the values, but they might be real important in creating the final output.
Also available as escaped version.
Web object meta data access.
Also available as escaped version.
Path (relative to document root) of new image, just the image name if IMAGE_URL is not set in the mapfile
Path (relative to document root) of new reference image.
Path (relative to document root) of new legend image.
Path (relative to document root) of new scalebar image.
Path to the query file (if savequery was set as a CGI Parameter).
Path to the map file (if savemap was set as a CGI Parameter).
Computed image center in pixels. Useful for setting imgxy form variable when map sizes change.
Computed image center X or Y coordinate in pixels.
Current image size in cols and rows (seperated by spaces).
Also available as escaped version.
Current image width or heigth.
Current image scale. The exact value is not appropriate for user information but essential for some applications. The value can be rounded e.g. using JavaScript or server side post processing.

sect2.title: Map Geometry

listitem.para: X and Y coordinate of mouse click.
Full mapextent (seperated by spaces).
Also available as escaped version.
Minimum / maximum X or Y coordinate of new map extent.

Raw mapextent, that is the extent before fitting to a window size (seperated by spaces). In cases where input came from imgbox (via Java or whatever) rawext refers to imgbox coordinates transformed to map units.
Also available as escaped version.
Minimum / maximum X or Y coordinate of a raw map/search extent.

sect2.para: The following substitutions are only available if the MapServer was compiled with PROJ support and a projection is defined in the mapfile

listitem.para: Longitude / latitude value of mouse click. Available only when projection enabled.
Full mapextent (seperated by spaces). Available only when projection enabled.
Also available as escaped version.
Minimum / maximum longitude or latitude value of mapextent. Available only when projection enabled.
All active layers formated for inclusion in a URL. (i.e. layer=layer1&layer=layer2 and so on...)
All active layers space delimited.
Also available as escaped version.

Used for making layers persistant across a map creation session. String is replaced with the keyword "checked", "selected" or "" if layername is on. Layername is the name of a layer as it appears in the map file. Does not work for default layers.
Layer meta data access.

Used for making the zoom factor persistant. Zoom values can range from -25 to 25 by default. The string is replaced with the HTML keyword "checked", "selected" or "" depending on the current zoom value.

Used for making the zoom direction persistant. Use check with a radio control or select with a selection list. See the demo for an example. The string is replaced with the HTML keyword "checked", "selected" or "" depending on the current value of zoomdir.

sect2.title: Query
sect2.para: The following substitutions are only available when the template is processed as a result of a query.

listitem.para: Extent of current shape plus a 5 percent buffer. Available only when processing query results.
Minimum / maximum X or Y coordinate of shape extent. Available only when processing query results.
Middle of the extent of current shape. Available only when processing query results.
X or Y coordinate of middle of the extent of the current shape. Available only when processing query results.
Index value of the current shape. Available only when processing query results.
Index value of the current tile. If no tiles used for the current shape this is replaced by "-1". Available only when processing query results.

Item name from the attribute table of a queried layer. Only attributes for the active query layers are accessible. Case must be the same as what is stored in the DBASE file. ArcView, for example, uses all caps for shapefile field names. Available only when processing query results.

sect2.para: For query modes that allow for multiple result sets, the following string substitutions are available. For FEATURESELECT and FEATURENSELECT modes the totals are adjusted so as not to include the selection layer. The selection layer results ARE available for display to the user.

listitem.para: Current layer name. Useful in layer headers and footers. Available only when processing query results.
Result number within the current layer. Starts at 1. Useful in query templates. Available only when processing query results.
Number of layers returning results. Useful in web header and footers. Available only when processing query results.
Total number of results within the current layer. Useful in web header and footers. Available only when processing query results.
Total number of results. Useful in web header and footers. Available only when processing query results.
Result number within all query results. Starts at 1. Useful in web header and footers. Available only when processing query results.
